org.tmotte.tmplz.apps

Class SiteGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.tmotte.tmplz.apps.SiteGenerator

  • public class SiteGenerator
extends java.lang.Object

    This class was built for instances where a servlet engine to run ContentViewer isn't available, so it is preferable to generate a "static" site from template content. It is primarily designed to be executed as a command-line program, so that most of its property methods have corresponding command-line parameters.

    General operation: SiteGenerator takes as its input a directory of template files, runs them through TemplateManager for parsing, and generates one file for each input file using Section.appendTo() on the parsed templates.

    • Method Detail

      • setInputDir

        public void setInputDir(java.lang.String dir)
        Sets the input directory. The application will not run without an input directory.

      • setOutputDir

        public void setOutputDir(java.lang.String dir)
        Sets the output directory. The application will not run without an output directory.

      • setRelativeContext

        public void setRelativeContext(boolean rel)
        Controls whether we fill any Slot named "Context" with a relative dotted-slashed path according to the position of the containing file in the hierarchy, starting with "./" at the root.

      • getTextLoadMgr

        public TextLoadMgr getTextLoadMgr()
        Use this to customize the internal TextLoadMgr.

      • setFileFilter

        public void setFileFilter(java.io.FileFilter filter)
        The filter will be used to determine whether files should be included. This should not restrict itself to templates if there are also image files, javascript, css etc.. Use setTemplateFileFilter() to determine what files are templates.

      • setTemplateFileFilter

        public void setTemplateFileFilter(java.io.FileFilter filter)
        This filter determines what files are treated as templates. All other files will simply be copied as-is if the target & source timestamps don't match.

      • setFillins

        public void setFillins(java.util.Map fillins)
        This will invoke Section.fillin(Map, true) against every template. This gives us a way to fillin an arbitrary set of Slots, recursively, in all templates.

      • process

        public void process()
             throws java.lang.Exception
        This executes a single update.

        java.lang.Exception

      • runCommandLine

        public void runCommandLine(java.lang.String[] args,
                  java.lang.Appendable out)
                    throws java.lang.Exception
        This is intended for use from a typical public static void main(String[]). Null values in the args array will be ignored (in case you have custom parameters). At the command line, add "-help" as a parameter to get a full list of command-line options.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
